intro: Hieracium camkorijense subsp. chloroleucolepium, commonly known as the chloroleucolepium hawkweed, is a flowering plant species native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are generally hairy and have a serrated margin, while the flowers are yellow with a distinctive central disc. This subspecies is noted for its specific ecological adaptations to its arid and semi-arid environments.
